docs.snippet: 8 P.M. (Ovation) THE FISHER KING (1991) Jeff Bridges portrays Jack Lucas, a radio disc jockey on the verge of suicide after his bullying leads a deranged caller to commit mass murder. He finds redemption in helping Parry (Robin Williams, above), h...
docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (Ovation) THE FISHER KING (1991) Jeff Bridges portrays Jack Lucas, a radio disc jockey on the verge of suicide after his bullying leads a deranged caller to commit mass murder. He finds redemption in helping Parry (Robin Williams, above), his indirect victim, who has been left homeless and driven half-insane by loss, in this film from Terry Gilliam. ''The best parts of 'The Fisher King' and its mad, whirling vision of modern life are those that see grief lurking just beneath the surface,'' Janet Maslin wrote in The New York Times. Mr. Williams received an Oscar nomination for best actor; Mercedes Ruehl won best supporting actress for her role as a video store owner who loves Jack despite it all. 6 A.M. (HBO) SING YOUR SONG (2011) In 1956 Harry Belafonte became the first recording artist to sell more than a million LPs with his album ''Calypso'' and in the process broke color barriers as he rose to success in an era of segregation. He won Grammy, Tony and Emmy Awards but was also blacklisted during the McCarthy era, spied on by the C.I.A. and the F.B.I., and threatened by the Ku Klux Klan, state troopers and Las Vegas Mafia bosses. This documentary from Susanne Rostock distills more than 700 hours of interviews, excerpts from F.B.I. files and archival film to chronicle the life and times of Mr. Belafonte (above center with John F. Kennedy), now 85, from his birth in Harlem and his childhood in Jamaica to his work with the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., his struggle against apartheid in South Africa and his actions to counter gang violence and the incarceration of youth.

docs.snippet: Hollywood keeps trying to turn Reese Witherspoon into a Sandra Bullock or Julia Roberts for a new generation. A new generation keeps refusing to take the memo.      Over the weekend, Ms. Witherspoon's poorly reviewed ''This Means War'' (20th Centu...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hollywood keeps trying to turn Reese Witherspoon into a Sandra Bullock or Julia Roberts for a new generation. A new generation keeps refusing to take the memo. Over the weekend, Ms. Witherspoon's poorly reviewed ''This Means War'' (20th Century Fox) extended the box office cold streak for the Oscar-winning Ms. Witherspoon, arriving in fifth place with about $17.6 million in ticket sales. Valentine's Day sneak-peek screenings for the action comedy, co-starring Chris Pine and Tom Hardy and costing about $65 million to make, contributed an additional $1.7 million.

docs.snippet: Flip to just about any page in ''Inside Oscar: The Unofficial History of the Academy Awards'' and something fascinating is bound to pop up.      In 1997, when ''Breathing Lessons,'' about a man who spent most of his life in an iron lung, won the a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Flip to just about any page in ''Inside Oscar: The Unofficial History of the Academy Awards'' and something fascinating is bound to pop up. In 1997, when ''Breathing Lessons,'' about a man who spent most of his life in an iron lung, won the award for best short documentary, the director, Jessica Yu, stepped to the mike and said, ''You know you've entered new territory when you realize your outfit cost more than your film.''
docs.abstract: Damien Bona, expert on the history of the Academy Awards, dies at age 56. Photo (M)

headline.main: Damien Bona, 56, Oscar Buff Who Became Oscar Scholar

docs.snippet: Though the artist himself might disagree, it would seem that Julian Schnabel has not been much concerned, in life, with the concept of negative space. As anyone who has ever met him, seen one of his paintings or visited one of his homes will tell ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Though the artist himself might disagree, it would seem that Julian Schnabel has not been much concerned, in life, with the concept of negative space. As anyone who has ever met him, seen one of his paintings or visited one of his homes will tell you: He takes up all the space available, and more. But peel him away from the frame, and you find that what used to be the background has quieter and more intriguing virtues. Olatz Schnabel, the Basque-born, Paris-raised former model who for over 17 years was Schnabel's muse and wife, has dedicated a large portion of her life to throwing her husband into even greater relief. Almost as soon as she met him, she gave up her high-end, global, fun-based career (Olatz owned homes in Paris, San Sebastian, Bali and Ibiza) to curate shows for him in Mexico; to influence, inspire and translate. It's fairly safe to say that ''Before Night Falls,'' the movie that won Javier Bardem an Oscar nomination, could not have come about without her. And she had as much to do with the design of the old West Village perfume factory that would later become the pink Venetian folly, the Palazzo Chupi, as Julian did.
docs.abstract: Olatz Schnabel, ex-wife of artist and filmmaker Julian Schnabel, has established new home in London with few trappings of her former life; is starting a new design company called Interiors by Olatz. Photos (M)
